page.title: 02Primary School, Wick
page.content: Pulteneytown Academy Primary School was opened in 1959.There are 210 pupils and 11 teachers,with an average class of 25.In our special education unit we have six pupils with one teacher.In 1975 the nursery,which now has a roll of 40 children between the ages of three and four years old,was built. There have been two headteachers since the opening of the school.Mrs Gunn,our headmistress for the past 9 years,left to take up an appointment in Nairn on 17th May,1985. In school there are country dancing and recorder clubs.During the summer term the football and netball teams compete in inter-school matches. 70 to 80 children have school lunches daily.
